pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:6.2: At that time, after giving the full ordination to her students, the nun Thullanandā neither guided them nor had them guided for two years.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:6.4: and they did not know what was allowable and what was not.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:7.1: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:7.2: “How can Venerable Thullanandā give the full ordination to her students and then neither guide them nor have them guided for two years?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:7.3: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:7.6: How can the nun Thullanandā give the full ordination to her students and then neither guide them nor have them guided for two years?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:7.7: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:7.8: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:8.1: ‘If a nun gives the full ordination to her student, and then neither guides her nor has her guided for two years, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:11.2: she does not herself guide her, through recitation, through questioning, through instruction, though teaching.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:12.3: If she thinks, “I will neither guide her nor have her guided for two years,” then by the mere fact of giving up the duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:13.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc68:14.1: The eighth training rule is finished.
